results.title: As Big Tech Grows in the Pandemic, Seattle Grows With It
results.abstract: Despite an overall decline in office leasing in the United States, technology companies gobbled up more space in the Seattle area than they had the previous year.

multimedia.caption: Facebook, which is based in Menlo Park, Calif., has signed new leases for office space in the Seattle area, including one for an 11-story building in Bellevue.

results.abstract: Jeff Bezos’ rocket company will launch the man who played Captain Kirk along with three other passengers on a short up and down flight to the edge of space.

results.title: Lifestyles of the Rich and Gullible: Theranos and Ozy Edition
results.abstract: Average investors were not able to get in on the last decade’s start-up boom in private markets. Once that seemed unfair. Now it looks lucky.

results.title: Lawmakers See Path to Rein In Tech, but It Isn’t Smooth
results.abstract: If what faces Big Tech is anything like what happened to Big Tobacco, the road ahead is likely to be a yearslong battle over proposed rules and regulations.

results.title: Facebook and its apps suffer another outage.
results.abstract: All of Facebook’s main products — Instagram, WhatsApp, Messenger and the “big blue app” of Facebook — were inaccessible to at least some users around 3 p.m. Eastern time.

multimedia.caption: Facebook’s headquarters in Menlo Park, Calif. The outage on Monday was a planetary-scale demonstration of how essential the company’s services have become to daily life.
multimedia.copyright: Kelsey McClellan for The New York Times

results.title: China’s Tech Antitrust Campaign Snares Meituan, a Food-Delivery Giant
results.abstract: The $530 million fine is Beijing’s second major penalty this year against an internet company accused of monopolistic practices.

multimedia.caption: In addition to being fined, Meituan was ordered to refund more than 1.6 million restaurants and other merchants for deposits they paid as part of exclusivity agreements with the platform.
multimedia.copyright: Greg Baker/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images

results.title: Google bans ads on content, including YouTube videos, with false claims about climate change.
results.abstract: “We’ve heard directly from a growing number of our advertising and publisher partners who have expressed concerns about ads that run alongside or promote inaccurate claims about climate change,” the company said.
results.byline: By Daisuke Wakabayashi and Tiffany Hsu

multimedia.caption: An aircraft drops fire retardant on a ridge during the Walbridge fire in Healdsburg, Calif., last year. Google said it will no longer allow ads that promote climate change denial.

results.title: Robert Schiffmann, Inventive Guru of the Microwave, Dies at 86
results.abstract: As a scientist he saw the potential of microwave ovens when he observed one heating up a sandwich in the 1960s. Microwaveable oatmeal, among other advances, was in his future.

multimedia.caption: The scientist Robert Schiffmann in an undated photo. He developed products (like microwaveable caramel popcorn) and processes that advanced microwave cooking.
multimedia.copyright: Evelyn Floret/The LIFE Picture Collection, via Shutterstock
